operations.notes: Delete Auth configuration from the cluster. This will also delete all the directories configured in the cluster.
Get the complete Auth configuration including directories configured in the cluster.
Modify the Auth configuration excluding directories configured in the cluster.
Update the Auth configuration excluding directories configured in the cluster.
Add Auth types to the existing Auth types.
Get Auth types configured in Auth configuration.
Update Auth types configured in the Auth configuration.
Get the client authentication status configured on the cluster.
Enable/disable client authentication on the cluster.
Update client authentication on the cluster.

operations.summary: Delete client chain certificate for authentication.
operations.notes: Delete client chain certificate on the cluster.
Get the list of Directories configured in the cluster.
Add Directory config to the cluster.

parameters.description: Username, active directory name and password to authenticate

operations.notes: Delete Directory config with the specified name.
Get Directory with the specified name.
Remove Auth types from the existing Auth types.

ca_chain.description: The content of the CA Chain certificate.

enable_client_auth.description: The status of the client authentication.

name.description: The name of the CA Chain certificate.

directory_url.notes: Needs to be a proper ldap url

service_account_password.description: The password to use for the service account.

service_account_username.description: The username to use with the service account.

group_member_attribute.description: Unique identifier in group that associates users to the group.

group_member_attribute_value.description: User attribute that will be used to group entity to associate user to the group.

group_object_class.description: Group Object class, identifier for object type group.

user_object_class.description: User object class, unique identifier for object user type

username_attribute.description: Unique identifier for each user which can be used forauthentication.

directory_name.description: Directory name to test LDAP configuration.

enabled.description: Whether auto login is enabled or not.

service_account_d_t_o.description: The service account info to be used for auto login.
